Hi,

Recently I came across a presentation(http://www.infoq.com/presentatio=
ns/robinson-restful-enterprise)  by Ian Robinson  where he clarifies the ro=
le of Media types and schema language with the following statement:



"med=
ia type for helping tune the hypermedia engine, schema for structure" (http=
://jim.webber.name/2008/11/23/61766710-3def-4dd9-9e36-b8d3147d14b1.aspx)

i=
.e media type description includes the processing model that identifies hyp=
ermedia controls and defines what methods are applicable for the resources,=
 the structure of the representation is the responsibility of schema langua=
ges. This means that an application can have a single media type describing=
 the hypermedia controls. However, ATOM defines multiple media types. My qu=
estions are:

Why does ATOM require multiple media types? Shouldn't one med=
ia type describing the hypermedia control suffice?

When does it make sense=
 to have multiple media types within a single application?
